title: Help to use dot operator does not take into account auto-dereferencing

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
### Code

```Rust
struct A;

impl A {
    fn a(self) {}
}

fn main() {
    let x = &A;
    a(*x);
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
error[E0425]: cannot find function `a` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:9:5
  |
1 | struct A;
  | --------- similarly named unit struct `A` defined here
...
9 |     a(*x);
  |     ^
  |
help: a unit struct with a similar name exists
  |
9 |     A(*x);
  |     ~
help: use the `.` operator to call the method `a` on `A`
  |
9 |     (*x).a();
  |     ~  ~~~~~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error[E0425]: cannot find function `a` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:9:5
  |
1 | struct A;
  | --------- similarly named unit struct `A` defined here
...
9 |     a(*x);
  |     ^
  |
help: a unit struct with a similar name exists
  |
9 |     A(*x);
  |     ~
help: use the `.` operator to call the method `a` on `A`
  |
9 |     x.a();
  |      ~~~~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
```


### Rationale and extra context

`.` auto-dereferences, but this is not taken into account when one dereferences in the existing function call.

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

If a method exists on the reference that would shadow the method on the object, then the existing help is fine.
